title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations for child care assistance for military dependents under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2004 to 2008 for this purpose. The Secretary will provide grants to eligible persons for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria, and an eligible person is a parent of such dependents. A parent who is the primary caregiver for dependents of a member of the Armed Forces on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. A parent who is the primary caregiver for dependents of a member of the Armed Forces involved in a military operation and resides permanently at least 50 miles from the nearest military installation with child care facilities. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with required information, including details of the child care provider. The grant is intended for dependents of Armed Forces members involved in specific military operations. The grant under this section is exempt from certain provisions of the subchapter, excluding section 658P and its referenced provisions. Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to change references to appropriations under different sections.
